item.title: SOMA for Switch debut trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/soma-for-switch-debut-trailer

  • Switch

Switch version coming soon.

Abylight Studios and Frictional Games have released the first trailer for the Switch version of horror game SOMA, which was first announced back in January.

Here is an overview of the game, via Abylight Studios:

Originally developed by the masterminds at Frictional Games, this critically acclaimed science-fiction horror masterpiece is making its way to Nintendo‘s hybrid console, meticulously optimized to deliver an uncompromised experience. Get ready to question reality and survive a nightmare unlike any other.

Dive headfirst into PATHOS-II, a desolate underwater research facility where the lines between human and machine blur. As you explore the eerie, submerged corridors under the Atlantic Ocean, you’ll be thrust into a fight for survival against a hostile world that forces you to confront the very nature of consciousness and what it truly means to be human. SOMA is renowned for its profound narrative and unsettling atmosphere, earning a formidable Metacritic score of 84 and cementing its place as a genre-defining psychological thriller.

Abylight Studios has worked to ensure that this Nintendo Switch version of SOMA is a full, faithful adaptation. Experience the terrifying world of SOMA with optimized performance, stunning visuals, and the immersive sound design that made the original a sensation, now playable wherever you go. SOMA will be compatible with Switch 2.

SOMA is currently available for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG.

A release date for the Switch version of SOMA has yet to be announced.

Watch the trailer below.

item.title: Kemono Teatime adds Switch version, delayed to September
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/kemono-teatime-adds-switch-version-delayed-to-september

  • PC
  • Switch

No longer due out this spring.

Cafe management ASMR game Kemono Teatime will launch for Switch and PC via Steam in September, a delay from its previously planned spring release window, developer Studio Lalala announced. The Switch version is newly announced. The game will support English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options.

Here is an overview of the game, via Studio Lalala:

A Kemomimi Cafe ASMR Adventure

Relax in this world where animal ears are a normal part of everyday life. Here in Melodius, you can whip up whatever blends of tea you desire in your favorite cafe as you play through an adorable story. Come now and live out your bestest and cutest life—down to the last drop. Though, you do know that once it’s run out, that’s it, right? It’d do you best to learn that all good things come to an end.

Meet all the Kemomimis that come through the cafe and help them wind down, spend a cute and adorable time sipping on some tea, and come to terms with their ultimate fates.

Tea-Making Simulator

Create your own unique teas with our stock of 9 black teas, 15 herbs, and 6 secret ingredients. Get to know the customers and make them something that they’ll love while you immerse yourself in the wonderful sounds of the tea-making process.

The Kemomimi Customers

All the customers have animal ears! Please savor each encounter and goodbye while you can—You’re sure to have a very special and unforgettable time here with all the people you meet.

Featuring an Homage to “Nyanyanyanyanyanyanya!” by Snail‘s House as the Theme Song

The theme song for this game is an homage to daniwell’s “Nyanyanyanyanyanyanya!,” made by Snail’s House with lyrics written and sung by Kotori Koiwai. In the newly released teaser trailer, you can view the short version. Immerse yourself in the KAWAII Moratorium—an escape from daily life filled with cuteness—enriched with the charm of Kemono Teatime.

  • Song Title: “KAWAII Moratorium ~Nyanyanyanyanyanyanya!~”
  • Music: Snail’s House
  • Lyrics: Kotori Koiwai
  • Vocal: Kotori Koiwai

An homage to:

  • Original: “Nyanyanyanyanyanyanya!”
  • Music and Lyrics: daniwell

Staff

This game is co-produced by Fuyuki Hayashi (Studio Lalala) and voice actress Kotori Koiwai, featuring ASMR from Koiwai’s ASMR brand “kotoneiro,” with NOCO as the main visual/character designer and music provided by Snail’s House, known for their YouTube channel with over 1.3 million subscribers. This adventure game promises to deliver cute aesthetic through both visuals and audio.

  • Production: Fuyuki Hayashi / Kotori Koiwai
  • Planning and Writing: Fuyuki Hayashi
  • Direction: Fuyuki Hayashi / Takahiro Akuta
  • Programming: ART Co.,Ltd.
  • Key Visual and Character Design: NOCO
  • Pixel Art: curemoto / OYUZAKI / Sky Scraper Project / Mokuya / Akayu
  • Logo: Hiroto Sugahara
  • Music: Snail’s House
  • ASMR: kotoneiro
  • Pixel Animation: APO+
  • Animation: mamesuzu

item.title: Okayu Nyumu! sequel in development
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/okayu-nyumu-sequel-in-development

Entergram will produce a new entry in the Okayu Nyumu! romance visual novel game series starring and overseen by Hololive Virtual YouTuber Nekomata Okayu, the company announced.

Okayu Nyumu! launched for PlayStation 4 and Switch on February 27 in Japan, and is coming to PC via Steam on August 7 worldwide.

Detailed information about the new entry was not announced.

item.title: Nioh series shipments and digital sales top eight million
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/nioh-series-shipments-and-digital-sales-top-eight-million

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5

One million copies sold since October 2022.

Total worldwide shipments and digital sales for the Nioh series have surpassed eight million units, publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Team Ninja announced.

The new milestone comes two years and seven months after the series achieved seven million shipments in October 2022.

Nioh first launched for PlayStation 4 on February 7, 2017, followed by PC via Steam on November 7, 2017 and Epic Games Store on September 9, 2021. Nioh 2 first launched for PlayStation 4 on March 12, 2020, followed by PC via Steam on February 5, 2021 and Epic Games Store on September 9, 2021. A Nioh Collection including remastered versions of both games launched for PlayStation 5 on February 5, 2021.
